element.title: 1. Installation
element.text: Informations about the Installation of Zicore's Minecraft Admin

element.title: 1.1 Download
element.text: Pick the latest Version from the link below and download it. Extract the contents to a folder.

element.title: 1.2.1 server.properties
element.text:
Open the server.properties file and have a look at these two lines:
(Default) server-ip= server-port=25565
In order to get ZMA run, you need you change the port to another one e.g. 25567.
(Working with ZMA) #Minecraft server properties #Fri Feb 25 20:03:06 CET 2011 level-name=world hellworld=false spawn-monsters=false monsters=false online-mode=true spawn-animals=true no-animals=true server-ip= max-players=20 pvp=true server-port=25567 white-list=false
'server-ip=' should be clear

element.title: 1.2.2 ZMA Settings
element.text:
Start ZMA and press CTRL + T to open the settings dialog. (Settings->Config) You'll see a dialog like in the picture below.
The most important settings are: java path, startparameters and minecraft jar you see the reference settings in the picture.
Be sure that the java path matches yours and be aware that, if you use a x86 system, there is no Program Files(x86). Use Program Files instead.
If you're done press OK to save the settings.

element.title: 1.2.3 Tunnel
element.text:
Start ZMA and switch to the Tunneling 'Tab'
There is a 'server port' and a 'public port' The port players will connect to, is the 'public port'.
Forward the public port in your router,firewall,windows-firewall etc. The 'server port', is the port on which the server is actually running on. You should have already defined that in the 'server.properties' file.
(For example:) #Minecraft server properties #Fri Feb 25 20:03:06 CET 2011 level-name=world hellworld=false spawn-monsters=false monsters=false online-mode=true spawn-animals=true no-animals=true server-ip= max-players=20 pvp=true server-port=25567 white-list=false

element.title: 1.2.4 Starting the server
element.text:
After the tunnel is set up, you can start the server with pressing CTRL + S or click on Server->Start. Two text labels should go green now on the bottom, which are showing wether the server is running.
On starting the server you should see something like this in the Input/Output 'Tab' 2011-03-25 21:18:26 [INFO] Starting minecraft server version Beta 1.3 2011-03-25 21:18:26 [INFO] Loading properties 2011-03-25 21:18:26 [INFO] Starting Minecraft server on *:25567 2011-03-25 21:18:26 [INFO] Preparing level "world" 2011-03-25 21:18:26 [INFO] Preparing start region 2011-03-25 21:18:27 [INFO] Done (927674175ns)! For help, type "help" or "?"
Try to connect with the minecraft client now.

element.title: 1.2.4.1 Common problems
element.text: List of common problems with ZMA and how to get around it

element.title: Q: I stuck at logging in
element.text: A: switch to the tunneling tab and check if there are the same ports. The ports must be different! See 1.2.3 for this.

element.title: Q: i get **** FAILED TO BIND TO PORT !:
element.text:
2011-03-25 21:23:26 [INFO] Starting minecraft server version Beta 1.3 2011-03-25 21:23:26 [INFO] Loading properties 2011-03-25 21:23:26 [INFO] Starting Minecraft server on *:25567 2011-03-25 21:23:26 [WARNING] **** FAILED TO BIND TO PORT! 2011-03-25 21:23:26 [WARNING] The exception was: java.net.BindException: Address already in use: JVM_Bind 2011-03-25 21:23:26 [WARNING] Perhaps a server is already running on that port?
A: See answer from above, the ports must be different

element.title: Q: I am still having this issues
element.text: (Regarding: **** FAILED TO BIND TO PORT) A: After changing the ports in ZMA, restart it and then open the taskmanager, and kill all java.exe processes. Start the server with ZMA again.
